data: FCCLA was founded in 1945.
The offical colors of FCCLA are red and white.
The offical flower of FCCLA is the red rose.
The FCCLA motto is 'Towards New Horizons'.
The red rose symbolizes beauty in everyday living.
FCCLA is the only youth organization focused on immproving family life.
The color red in FCCLA symbolizes strength.
The color white in FCCLA symbolizes sincerity.
The organization changed names from FHA to FCCLA in 1999.
FCCLA was once called FHA, the Future Homemakers of America.
The Kentucky state FCCLA Advisor is Mrs. Ashleigh VanHoose.
Kentucky has two national officers for the 2025-2026 term.
FCCLA was founded in Chicago, Illinois.
Kentucky was the first state to charter a FCCLA chapter.
There are more than 250,000 FCCLA members.
The headquarters for Kentucky FCCLA is in Frankfort, Kentucky.
The second week of February is FCCLA week.
The Kentucky state conference is held in Louisville, Kentucky.
FCCLA national headquarters is in Herndon, Virginia.
There are 5,400 FCCLA chapters across the nation.
The FCCLA tagline is 'The Ultimate Leadership Experience'.
Dolly Parton, Reba McEntire, and Bo Jackson were members of FCCLA.
The unoffical mascot of FCCLA is Rosie the Llama.
There are 10 national officers elected each year.
There are 52 state associations, all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands.
The current Chief Executive Officer of FCCLA is Sandy Spavone.
